intro: Psorospermum guineense, commonly known as African sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally in herbal medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
